p: In an educational context, social work authors note some adverse impacts of neoliberalism on social work university education in Australia and internationally. Neoliberal approaches to education promote individual success in an economy that rewards competition, self-interest and self-reliance, undermining the critical and emancipatory vision of higher education (Evans, 2020). In Australia, these impacts are evident through the alignment of universities with the national government’s performance-based funding model (Tehan, 2019) and the pursuit of ‘employability’, ‘job-ready graduates’ and ‘career and future focused’ teaching.
